6c3f714f-83be-4cc8-97fc-2e5917fbd6a1.description: The badge earner displayed competency in the methodology for writing legal case briefs using the IRAC method. They successfully completed exercises that fulfilled three main areas of focus : (1) an introduction to the purposes and uses case briefs; (2) a detailed examination of each of the components of a typical case brief; and (3) application of the knowledge gained by submitting two case briefs.
6c3f714f-83be-4cc8-97fc-2e5917fbd6a1.name: Foundational Legal Writing Badge - Case Briefing

badge_template_activities.title: Completed two-hour interactive lesson and achieved a minimum of 80% on the lesson assessments
Read federal and state cases and example briefs of those cases
Drafted 2 cases briefs and received a satisfactory score on each submission

skills.name: The Importance Of Case Law And Precedence

ab5e411c-694c-42c4-82cb-79a98c8a6390.description: The earner of this badge can explain the requirements of a valid real estate contract and identify the remedies for default under such an agreement. Earners demonstrated an understanding of the role all parties to the transaction play in the procurement of real estate. They also reviewed a real estate contract for the sale and purchase of a home and showed that they understand its contents.
ab5e411c-694c-42c4-82cb-79a98c8a6390.name: Real Estate Contracts

badge_template_activities.title: Reviewed real estate purchase agreements and identified key concepts, clauses, and potential issues.
Briefed Florida Cases concerning breach of contract for residential and commercial real estate.
Submitted written assignments showing an understanding of the required elements of a valid real estate contract and the remedies available to parties.

febf1dd5-5feb-4da1-b466-e31f602f2fba.description: The earner of this badge can explain how agency relationships are created and terminated. They can compare and contrast different types of agency relationships and identify legal issues that may arise. While earning this badge, they demonstrated the ability to analyze the rights and duties that principals and agents have to one another and to third parties. The badge earner wrote professional emails to a hypothetical client and drafted a Power of Attorney document conforming with Florida law.
febf1dd5-5feb-4da1-b466-e31f602f2fba.name: Fundamentals of Agency Law

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an essay examination with a score of 80% or higher
Write communications to a hypothetical client seeking to create a Durable Power of Attorney.
Submit case briefs using the IRAC method.
Engage in a discussion focused on potential ethical issues in agency relationships.
Draft a Power of Attorney following the requirements of Florida law.

4eafe22d-f838-4fb7-b284-17103fef3309.description: The badge earner demonstrates an understanding of Florida law governing Limited Liability Companies and Partnerships. The earner can explain the purpose of these entities, how they function, their powers, and legal limitations. Earners scored over 80% on essay quizzes and exams. They read and discussed case law and submitted briefs on partnership dissolution and derivative actions. Earners drafted Partnership Agreement provisions, a Statement of Dissolution, and Articles of Organization.
4eafe22d-f838-4fb7-b284-17103fef3309.name: Foundation of Florida Business Entities

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 3 Essay Quizzes Focused on: General Partnerships, Limited Partnerships, and Limited Liability Companies. Scoring 80% or Higher
Complete a 12 Question Essay Examination with a score of 80% or Higher
Research, Complete, and Submit for Grading: a Partnership Registration Form, Draft Provisions of a Partnership Agreement, a Statement of Dissolution, and Articles of Organization.
Draft and Submit for Grading 3 Case Briefs Using the IRAC Method.
Participate in Group Discussions Pertaining to Legal Issues Faced by Unincorporated Business Entities

58bc681c-b4b2-49ca-a4d7-067bd0b23bf0.description: The badge earner demonstrates an understanding of Florida probate law governing summary and formal administration. The earner can explain the process for both probate procedures as well as Disposition without Administration. Earners scored over 80% on essay assessments. They submitted case briefs; identified key areas of applicable FL Statutes; reviewed petitions, and compared and contrasted the Florida Probate system with other jurisdictions and the Uniform Probate Code.
58bc681c-b4b2-49ca-a4d7-067bd0b23bf0.name: Florida Probate Procedure

badge_template_activities.title: Discussed issues involving reasonably ascertainable creditors and contingent and conjectural claims.
Reviewed the following: Petition for Formal Administration, Petition for Summary Administration, Petition for Discharge, Disposition of Property without Administration form.
Researched the probate laws and procedures in a different jurisdiction and drafted a 1,500-word summary comparing and contrasting those laws to Florida's.
Submitted a case brief for an issue before the Florida Supreme court regarding probate administration.
Reviewed Chapter 733 of Florida Statutes and identified and summarized key provisions of the probate code.

b2bc26a6-4f6d-405d-b541-ef2b0b7ee148.description: Earners of this badge examined negligence over five weeks. They identified the criteria used to assess the reasonableness of a person’s conduct and applied the concepts of negligence per se and res ipsa loquitur. They described the standard of care expected of landlords and the concept of vicarious liability. Earners distinguished actual cause and proximate cause and explained the impact of intervening and superseding causes. They recognized the components of damages and can categorize them.
b2bc26a6-4f6d-405d-b541-ef2b0b7ee148.name: Torts & Negligence

badge_template_activities.title: Earned at least an 80% score on five quizzes covering the elements of negligence and their application.
Drafted legal briefs of cases covering: Landlord/Tenant Liability, Negligence Per Se, Causation Problems, and Punitive Damages.
Reviewed numerous pleadings and cases.
Researched and discussed a variety of negligence related topics including Duty of Care, Florida Negligence Statutes, Proximate Causation, and Comparative Negligence.
